intro: Descurainia leptoclada var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular descurainia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, contributing to its ecological role in pollination.
